TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit ProfileInfo extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides information about a user profile.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileInfo> class is used to represent information about a user profile from the data store, including the last date and time when profile properties were retrieved or updated, the user name associated with the profile, and whether the profile is for an anonymous or authenticated user.
<xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileInfo> objects are constructed and returned as part of a <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileInfoCollection> by the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider.GetAllProfiles%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider.GetAllInactiveProfiles%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider.FindProfilesByUserName%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider.FindInactiveProfilesByUserName%2A> methods of a <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider>.
## Examples For an example of a <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider> implementation that creates a <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileInfoCollection> of <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileInfo> objects for user profiles in a data store, see [Implementing a Profile Provider](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/58de6e99-31a7-41b9-93ed-51b9b4a67e98).

Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileInfo?displayProperty=nameWithType> constructor is not intended to be used from your code. Instead, use the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileInfo.%23ctor%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
<xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileInfo> objects are constructed and returned as part of a <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileInfoCollection> by the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider.GetAllProfiles%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider.GetAllInactiveProfiles%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider.FindProfilesByUserName%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider.FindInactiveProfilesByUserName%2A> methods of a <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileInfo> object is used to represent information about a user profile from the data store, including the last date and time when profile properties were retrieved or updated, the user name associated with the profile, and whether the profile is for an anonymous or authenticated user.
<xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileInfo> objects are constructed and returned as a <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileInfoCollection> by the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider.GetAllProfiles%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider.GetAllInactiveProfiles%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider.FindProfilesByUserName%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider.FindInactiveProfilesByUserName%2A> methods of a <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider>.
## Examples For an example of a <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider> implementation that creates a <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileInfoCollection> of <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileInfo> objects for user profiles in a data store, see [Implementing a Profile Provider](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/58de6e99-31a7-41b9-93ed-51b9b4a67e98).

Docs.summary: Gets the size of the profile property names and values stored in the data source.
Docs.value: The size of the profile property names and values stored in the data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Profile.SqlProfileProvider> calculates the size of the profile as the total size of the string and binary columns that store the profile property values and the column that stores the profile property names. The size of the columns is determined using the SQL Server DATALENGTH function.
